title: Ticket #2898: mktime() is dominating compute cycles when used in non-DST timezone
description:
While profiling the collector, I noticed that mktime was using an amazing 60% of the collector's cycles. It appears to happen due to CondorVersionInfo invoking mktime with tm_isdst = 1, which causes mktime to mysteriously burn a gigantic amount of time when invoked in a timezone not observing DST (e.g. Arizona, where I happen to live):

For more info, see: http://erikerlandson.github.com/blog/2012/03/19/interaction-between-mktime-and-tm-isdst-a-compute-cycle-landmine/

When I was profiling, the collector, I set up a pool with 50 slots, and ran 200 jobs with 100 submitters, and also set up a "condor_status -any" every few seconds, to simulate a pool with a busy collector.
remarks:
Did not get to this one in 7.9, will put it into 8.1
